entry.title: Fix a corner case where `beforetoggle` opens a new popover
entry.content:
See [1]/[2] for details, but there was a case where the `beforetoggle`

event could open a new popover while an old one was closing. This

led to odd situations where DCHECKs and infinite loops ensued.

This CL breaks that loop, or rather converts it to an explicit one,

by repeating the "hide all popovers until" algorithm until all

popovers are closed. That admits an explicit loop, which is the

popover equivalent of `while(true) {}`: when the `beforetoggle`

handler for a popover re-shows the popover.



[1] https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/9197

[2] https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/9196



Bug: 1307772

Change-Id: Ie269ef222f458f361020de27113614cece94d20d

entry.title: Make GetSiteInstanceForNavigation etc use ErrorPageProcess
entry.content:
Currently OnRequestFailedInternal() uses ComputeErrorPageProcess()

to pick the process to commit an error page in, and possibly calls

GetFrameHostForNavigation() later on to pick an appropriate RFH.

The latter function only knows whether the navigation is "a failure"

or not, and not details of the process requirements for the error

page is.



This CL makes it so that we also pass the ErrorPageProcess

requirement to GetFrameHostForNavigation(), which is required for

crrev.com/c/4457734, where we make all cases of the error page RFH

selection process to go through GetFrameHostForNavigation().



Bug: 936696

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.title: [omnibox][ml] Ensure only matches with scoring signals are sent to model
entry.content:
Currently scoring signals are found on all ACMatches, whether they are

actually populated or not. Therefore, the ACController uses the match

type to decide whether or not the scoring signals should be sent to

the model. This adds unnecessary complexity and is error prone, as

unpopulated scoring signals may end up being sent to the model.



Ideally the controller should not have to do any additional checks to

decide if a match is eligible for model scoring. That detail should be

handled at the provider, annotator, and deduplication steps. This CL

avoids that check by making ACMatch's `ScoringSignals` an optional

member variable.



Note that it is not strictly necessary to use `absl::optional`. It is

possible to determine if a proto message is non-empty by using

`MessageLite::ByteSizeLong()`. However that requires deserializing the

message which can end up being costly in an autocomplete session.



Bug: 1405555

entry.title: [PCCT] Ensure the closing animation comes prior to the tab closure
entry.content:
Closing animation was being done with the blank content as the content

and its view got already destroyed by the time the animation got

started.



To keep the content visible during the animation, tab closure process

now starts the animation before the actual tab/content destruction

takes places.

entry.title: [Performance Controls] Introduce discard time pref
entry.content:
Creates a pref to control the discard time in minutes for memory saver.

The UI will be implemented at a later date, so to control the pref this

CL also introduces a command line switch that the UPTM reads to set the

default value of the pref. Once the multistate memory saver is rolled

out, the user will be able to control the pref from the settings page,

and this command line switch will no longer be needed.

entry.title: float: Handle case where a tucked window could freeze a window
entry.content:
The tucked window installs a null window targeter. When getting

untucked back to maximized state, immersive mode also installs a

scoped window targeter. With certain steps (more details in the bug),

immersive mode can install their own targeter before the scoped

tuck object is deleted, and after immersive mode ends install the null

targeter than tuck used.



To get around this, we use a safer method to block events that does

not require precise ordering.



A test is underway at crrev.com/c/4460812, but we would like to get

the fix in first.



Test: manual

Bug: b/278917878

Change-Id: I80856e9ad0c62ecbd1db020b689a496e1ed0faa0

entry.title: float: Speculative fix for `MultitaskMenuNudgeController` crash
entry.content:
The stack trace shows us creating the nudge widget, and during

creation, the parent window gets a stacking changed notification,

which tried to update the nudge which is still being created.



Since the parent can get notifications by adding a transient child,

a speculative fix is to move the observations after the nudge widget

is created, as it isn't necessary for such early observations.



Test: none

Bug: b/277847123

entry.title: update_client: Fix architecture in update query
entry.content:
According to

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/preprocessor/predefined-macros?redirectedfrom=MSDN&view=msvc-170

```

_WIN64 Defined as 1 when the compilation target is 64-bit ARM or x64. Otherwise, undefined.

```



So we should not use `_WIN64` as the way to check x64 or arm64.



This CL changes the checks to use the standard macros defined in

"build/build_config.h" so avoid similar issues now and in the future.



Bug: b/279041205

Test: Manually tested when building win-arm64 Chrome on a x64 machine

Change-Id: I60f6ca38515e12842e2c9423690edf89c107f84f

entry.title: Make element references via idrefs functional when disconnected
entry.content:
Per the spec [1], computing the attr-associated element does not

depend on connectedness. Step 4 (which runs whenever there is *not*

an explicitly set attr-element) says:



-----

...return the first element candidate, in tree order, that meets the following criteria:



- candidate's root is the same as element's root,

- candidate's ID is contentAttributeValue, and

- candidate implements T.



If no such element exists, then return null.

-----



The issue prior to this CL is that `getElementById()` uses the

TreeOrderedMap, and elements are removed from the map when they are

removed from the document. A partial fix for non-idref (IDL) element

references was made with [2], and this is the second half.



[1] https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#attr-associated-element

[2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4371122



Fixed: 1427374

Change-Id: I2a089a5fa1a925d40761ae2275ed34f855791513

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4450333

Auto-Submit: Mason Freed

Reviewed-by: Xiaocheng Hu

Code-Coverage: Findit

Commit-Queue: Xiaocheng Hu

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2/test: Implement DPB Flush in H.264 Decoder
entry.content:
The H.264 decoder previously had implemented logic around where the DPB

would need to flush itself due to a new SPS configuration or an IDR

slice, but the DPB flush logic was never implemented.



This update implements the DPB Flush function in the H.264 decoder and

calls the flush function on a new SPS configuration as well as on a IDR

slice.



This change does not result in any additional test vectors being decoded

properly but will be necessary for future CL logic to be able to decode

bitstreams properly.



BUG=b:234752983

TEST=v4l2_stateless_decoder --video=BA1_Sony_D.h264 --md5=checksums.log

TEST=v4l2_stateless_decoder --video=CVSE2_Sony_B.h264 --md5=checksums.log



Change-Id: Id5879b3a6c7dd84d11d0f55f55252a6ecb07e42c

entry.title: [ChromeCart] Skip product extraction for non-cart pages
entry.content:
In the current code, we enforce gaps between cart extractions for

performance optimization purpose. This would lead to some extractions

being run later than when they were triggered. A bug in the existing

code is that we don't check if the user is still in cart page after

the forced gap time, hence potentially running extractions on the

wrong page. This CL fixes this issue by skipping the extraction if we

detect that user is no longer in the cart page after delay.



Bug: 1435560

entry.title: Revert "[Start] Prevent Start surface showing with the first initial tab"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ef584d94f2ad25d621266858dbd5acfef9dcf7ec.



Reason for revert: crbug.com/1435554



Original change's description:

> [Start] Prevent Start surface showing with the first initial tab

> created.

>

> The bug was caused by a timing issue: 1) both initializeState() and

> createInitialTab() get a false from shouldShowOverviewPageOnStart()

> when there isn't any Tab and homepage manager isn't ready. However,

> after createInitialTab() creates the first Tab, #onStartWithNative()

> checks shouldShowOverviewPageOnStart() again. Since there is a Tab

> created, shouldShowOverviewPageOnStart() goes through a different code

> path and returns true, and the Start surface is showing with an extra

> tab created. In this CL, we add a flag of whether the first initial

> Tab is being created, and prevent showing Start if this is true.

>

> Bug: 1422825

> Change-Id: I7d50884c912cb1938d8e979aad7b9b7b5885e957

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4429670

> Code-Coverage: Findit

> Reviewed-by: Yaron Friedman

> Commit-Queue: Xi Han

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1132449}



Bug: 1422825,1435554

entry.title: [PhoneHub] Cache attestation certificate for Phone Hub
entry.content:
We find out that generating attestation certificate is time consuming and may cause delay to send CrosState message after connection is established. We cache it during startup/first connection to reduce latency.



Tested: manually verified that it reduces the generating time to ~1ms once certificate is cached.

entry.title: Run ExtensionPreferenceApiLacrosBrowserTest with unique ash.
entry.content:
ExtensionPreferenceApiLacrosBrowserTest.Lacros is having a test

isolation issue for running with shared Ash instance. When the test

changes the value of chrome.accessibilityFeatures.autoclick in Ash,

the pref value change is observed by AccessibilityController and will

trigger popping up a dialog in Ash with the prompt about confirmation

of disabling autoclick. The dialog is not closed when the test is torn

down in Lacros and will affect other tests running after it. This cl

start a unique Ash to run with this test suite to avoid the test

isolation issue.



Bug: 1435317

entry.title: iwa: Add displayName field to SiteGroup type
entry.content:
This adds a displayName field to SiteGroup, which is used whenever

displaying the group in the UI, and replaces isolatedWebAppName and

extensionName. Similar changes were also made in RawSiteException,

SiteException, and RecentSitePermissions.



SiteGroup.etldPlus1 is now only used to identify the group, and never

for display purposes, and all display name logic lives in the C++

backend. This will allow us to replace etldPlus1 with

SiteSettingsHandler::GroupingKey in the future, which is not suitable

for displaying directly in the UI.

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2/test: Add H.264 Long Term Ref Marking
entry.content:
The H.264 decoder previously had implemented some reference picture

marking functions however it had not implemented picture marking for

when the adaptive_ref_pic_marking_mode flag is set. This reference

marking involves setting pictures as long term which also had not

previously been implemented.



This change implements long term reference picture marking as required

when the adaptive_ref_pic_marking_mode flag is set. To be able to set

this up, the H264SliceMetadata object definition is updated to reflect

long term pictures. DPB Functions were added to perform reference

picture marking and unmarking as described in H.264 8.2.4.



This update does not result in any additional bitstreams being decoded

properly however it will be integral in future CL's for proper frame

decoding.



BUG=b:234752983

TEST=v4l2_stateless_decoder --video=BA1_Sony_D.h264 --md5=checksums.log

TEST=v4l2_stateless_decoder --video=CVSE2_Sony_B.h264 --md5=checksums.log

process. This will act as the skeleton for the mojom piping needed to

Project design and security considerations are included in go/cros-nearby-presence-service. The bug for security review for the project is b/265362835.

process using the mojom receiver.

entry.title: Improve shelf layout flow
entry.content:
The main point is moving updates to display work area out of

`ShelfLayoutManager::LayoutShelf()`, to avoid rentering LayoutShelf()

in response to updates to the display work area - for example, updating

work area bounds may change the number of shown notifications (changing

display bounds would drive any in progress message center animation to

the end, causing the number of displayed notifications to change, and

thus potentially changing the status area preferred size). In addition,

not all state changes that required shelf to relayout require changing

display work area (for example, changes in status area, or scrollable

shelf view preferred size).



Logic to update work area is now moved after laying out the shelf, and

updating shelf work area insets and work area bounds is clumped

together, so it's easier to track (previously, work area insets were

set when calculating target bounds, and display work area got updated

after setting the display bounds, with no apparent reason).



While here, this consolidates calls to update shelf visibility and

layout shelf. There are few places where both `UpdateVisibilityState()`

and `LayoutShelf()` were called one after another, even though in

certain cases `UpdateVisibilityState()` actually performs a shelf

layout. To avoid this pattern, and potentially doubled shelf layouts,

this cl adds an argument to `UpdateVisibilityState()` to force layout,

even if the shelf visibility state remains unchanged.



BUG=b:276667320



Change-Id: Ic982de5c52378a3042ac5b6851c51877835bb68a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4424781

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.title: media/gpu: Fix reference frame logic in H264 VA-API decoding
entry.content:
Fix minor issues in reference frames logic in both our VA-API H264

delegate and our VA-API H264 platform decoding tests. Specifically:

- We were not correctly sorting reference frames before filling in the

VAPictureParameterBufferH264.

- We were not correctly marking long term reference frames as unused in

accordance with H264 specification 8.2.5.4.3.



These issues were relatively minor and papered over by some drivers, but

caused occasional bugs.



Bug: b:278872010

Test: Tested by running all H264 platform decoding and chrome stack

decoding tests on Rex.

entry.title: Create wrapper for third_party openxr_platform.h
entry.content:
The openxr_platform.h file is required to be included after certain

platform-specific dependencies. In order to ease the burden on includers

this change creates a wrapper file which can include those dependencies

before the header. This change also adds necessary DEPS entries and

visibility to ensure that we add new DEPS rules when expanding the

visibility of the openxr headers as well as a compile-time error to

help catch that this file has not been included directly already.

entry.title: [A11y] Extensible enum should not error at default value
entry.content:
If we add a new value to ax::mojom::Action (an extensible

enum) in Ash and then run against an older version of Lacros

that does not have that enum, it gets converted to the

default value of kNone, which is handled as a NOTREACHED

in RenderAccessibilityImpl. This means that any new value

added in Ash could cause crashes in Lacros.



Instead of passing an AXAction with kNone to the renderer,

we should fail to convert the mojo action from Ash in the

case where it represents an unsupported action type.



Bug: b:272150598

Change-Id: Id134539320ae766172695fb37fcd0a4a1c4a8349

AX-Relnotes: N/A

Test: Tried new ax::mojom::Action on Ash w/ old Lacros, crash without this patch and no crash with it

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4456627

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: David Tseng

entry.title: Fenced frames: Fix negative test cases of fenced frame event reporting.
entry.content:
In negative test cases where we expect the beacon from the

window.fence.reportEvent or the automatic beacon should not be sent,

the current tests directly check

ControllableHttpResponse::has_received_request(), without invoking

ControllableHttpResponse::WaitForRequest() first. As a result,

ControllableHttpResponse::has_received_request() will always be false,

since the RunLoop is never started.



To workaround this issue, we make a second request with different

content to the same ControllableHttpResponse. By verifying the content

received is from the second request, it implies the first request was

not sent as we expected. This works because ControllableHttpResponse

only handles one request.



Change-Id: Ice7aaba8f8cfacae54590760724013b105c95e6e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4442140

Reviewed-by: Dominic Farolino

Reviewed-by: Liam Brady

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.title: [a11y] Implement ax::mojom::Action::kBlur
entry.content:
Before this change, when in the browser process, the only way to

remove focus from an element was by setting the focus to the body of

the web page instead. We thought this was logically equivalent, since

clearing the focused element leads the focus to move to the body

anyway. This approach is technically right, but it had one oversight:

a JS focus event is fired on the body when we explicitly set the

focus on it while, when we tell Blink to clear the focused element,

it actually fires a blur event from the previously focused element.



This resulted in an extraneous focus event in JS, leading some

websites to act on this focus changed event. See the bug linked below

for a concrete example.



To fix this, we now implement the kBlur action, which can be called

from the browser process. As implemented, it leads to the expected

behavior (ie. no focus event is fired on the body).



Here's a simplified Before/After summary:



Before:

- Set focus explicitly on the root of the document

- JS blur event fired from the currently focused element (if any)

- JS focus event fired on the root of the document

- Focus changed event fired on ATs.



After:

- Remove focus from specific element

- JS blur event fired from the element this was called on, if focused

- Focus changed event fired on ATs to describe that the focus moved

to the root of the document.



Fixed: 1435061

Change-Id: I39aa2ad010455be920546852e4ea6122ae2fe5ea

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4455835

Auto-Submit: Benjamin Beaudry

Commit-Queue: Aaron Leventhal

Reviewed-by: Aaron Leventhal

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1134011}

entry.title: Identify PEFile bitness without win32file
entry.content:
The Python win32file GetBinaryType API can't handle ARM64 binaries

because the underlying Windows GetBinaryType function knows nothing

about them. This change works around that by using pefile to extract the

information.



This will get mini_installer_tests past a current blocker.

entry.title: Update VizContextProviderFactoryAsync's thread expectations
entry.content:
Updates VizContextProviderFactoryAsync to no longer take a task runner

and instead push the responsibility of ensuring that the callback is

run on an appropriate thread to the caller; which matches the more

broadly used pattern, especially given the BindPostTask helper which

can be used to make this guarantee. This simplifies the factory code/

binding and gives more flexibility to the caller.

entry.title: beforeunload returnValue is empty string should not prompt confirmation
entry.content:
By HTML spec, setting the returnValue to be the empty string should not

prompt the confirmation dialog for beforeunload event.



[1] https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/browsing-the-web.html#unloading-documents:event-beforeunload:~:text=the%20returnValue%20attribute%20of%20event%20is%20not%20the%20empty%20string

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2/test: Expand H.264 DPB into its own file
entry.content:
Previously the H.264 decoder had implemented a DPB to use for decoding

in its same header and source file. With the DPB logic getting large, it

is time for it to have its own file.



This change creates the h264_dpb source and header files for the

implementation of the DPB. The change also updates the BUILD.gn to add

the DPB files into the compilation process.



This update has no affect on the decoders ability to decode bitstreams

and serves only to clean up the codebase.



BUG=b:234752983

TEST=v4l2_stateless_decoder --video=BA1_Sony_D.h264 --md5=checksums.log

TEST=v4l2_stateless_decoder --video=CVSE2_Sony_B.h264 --md5=checksums.log

entry.title: [DownloadBubble] Compute info relevant to button state in update service
entry.content:
This moves the computation of the AllDownloadUIModelsInfo from the

per-window DownloadDisplayController to the per-profile

DownloadBubbleUpdateService. This avoids redundant fetching of models

from the update service, which is expensive and potentially causes jank

while downloading files, since the models are not needed (just the info

about them) in order to update the button state.

entry.title: Make the RWHVMac delegate creator return an autoreleased object
entry.content:
In ARC, when a C++ function returns an Objective-C object, the default

is that it's an autoreleased object, so change the creator function to

do that.



Because the creator function is in the content API, rename it; while

it's unlikely that any embedders have overridden this, break the build

as a sign that their code needs to change.



In addition, making the object autoreleased shifts lifetimes a bit,

triggering some raw_ptr warnings, so harden the /chrome version of the

class some.



Bug: 1280317

entry.title: Graphite: Move code from SkiaImageRep to SkiaGaneshImageRep
entry.content:
This change adds ScopedGaneshRead/WriteAccess and moves code for

Ganesh specific end state logic to SkiaGaneshImageRepresentation.

It also makes the BeginScopedRead/WriteAccess methods pure virtual

and implement them in the subclass. It makes the return type of

ProduceSkiaGanesh calls to return this new subclass.



Note: Will move the promise textures to subclass in a follow-up.

entry.title: MiraclePtr: Rewrite chromeos-ash [4/N]
entry.content:
This was was automated.

It rewrites chromeos-ash and annotate the dangling pointers.



This part was split out of the root CL:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4459392



number file selected

------ ----------- --------

1700 chrome/

1407 ash/

626 chromeos/ x

147 components/

53 ui/

16 extensions/

14 media/

9 remoting/

8 services/

5 content/

3 cc/

1 gpu/

1 crypto/



Steps:



1. Execute the rewriter:

./tools/clang/rewrite_raw_ptr_fields/rewrite-multiple-platforms.sh chromeos-ash



2. Execute all the tests. Print the dangling pointers using

https://godbolt.org/z/o8adYnc7a idea. Then apply the edits using:

https://github.com/ArthurSonzogni/chrome-dangling-ptr-apply-edit



3. Apply `git cl format`



4. Add `ExperimentalAsh`. This happened using a vim macro on the root

patch. Overall there are exactly 7461 new pointers, and 183 dangling

pointers.



5. Apply `git cl format`

entry.title: [Extensions][WebView] Properly classify app resources in webviews
entry.content:
Platform app resources in webviews should be classified as

Feature::UNBLESSED_EXTENSION_CONTEXT, but are currently classified as

Feature::BLESSED_EXTENSION_CONTEXT on the renderer side and

Feature::CONTENT_SCRIPT_CONTEXT on the browser side.



Fix this.



For the renderer side, determine if the context is in an extension

resource in a webview by checking if the process has a corresponding

webview partition ID set, which is always the case for webview guests.

Make this easier to tell by updating Dispatcher::webview_partition_id_

to an optional instead of just a std::string so that it's

more clear when it has never been set.



On the browser side, classify this as an UNBLESSED_EXTENSION_CONTEXT

if it belongs to a process associated with a webview owned by the

extension and the URL is same-origin with the extension.



This fixes the classification so that both browser and renderer agree

these contexts are UNBLESED_EXTENSION_CONTEXTs.



Bug: 1430991

Change-Id: Ia979dca2c7ce1a73d7fadf3bf553f9cabac64a40
